com.samsung.android.sdk.remotesensor

Class SrsRemoteSensorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.remotesensor.SrsRemoteSensorManager

  • public class SrsRemoteSensorManager
extends Object
    This class provides access to the wearable device sensor. Make sure to always disable sensors you do not need, especially when your activity is paused. Failure to do so can drain the battery in just a few hours. Note that the system does not disable sensors automatically when the screen turns off.
    See Also:
    SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener, SrsRemoteSensorEvent, SrsRemoteSensor

    • Method Detail

      • getSensorList

        public List<SrsRemoteSensor> getSensorList(int type)
        Get the list of available sensors based on the given sensor type.

        Make multiple calls to get different sensor types, or use SrsRemoteSensor.TYPE_ALL to get all the sensors.

        Parameters:
        type - The type of sensor requested.
        Returns:
        The list of sensors matching the requested type.

      • registerListener

        public boolean registerListener(SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener listener,
                       SrsRemoteSensor sensor,
                       int rate,
                       int maxBatchReportLatency)
        Register a listener for a sensor with the given rate and maxBatchReportLatency. Note: If this method is called for trigger sensors like SrsRemoteSensor.TYPE_WEARING_STATE, it will respond only once. After event notification, the listener will be unregistered automatically.
        Parameters:
        listener - The SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener instance.
        sensor - The SrsRemoteSensor instance.
        rate - The desired delay between 2 consecutive events, in microseconds. This is only a hint to the system. Events can be received faster (usually) or slower than the specified rate. The valid values are: SENSOR_DELAY_SLOW, SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL, SENSOR_DELAY_FAST, SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST The delay in microseconds.
        maxBatchReportLatency - The maximum time an event in the batch can be delayed, in microseconds.
        Returns:
        true if the batch mode is successfully enabled for the sensor. false if the batch mode fails for the sensor.

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener listener,
                      SrsRemoteSensor sensor)
        Unregister a listener from a specified sensor.
        Parameters:
        listener - The EventListener instance.
        sensor - The sensor from which to unregister.

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener listener)
        Unregisters a listener from all the sensors for which it is registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - The EventListener instance.

      • requestTriggerSensor

        public boolean requestTriggerSensor(SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener listener,
                           SrsRemoteSensor sensor)
        This method is only for trigger sensors like SrsRemoteSensor.TYPE_WEARING_STATE. They respond only once. The requestTriggerSensor() method should be called every time the data is needed. Because this method is for one time data request, unregistering step is not necessary Note 1: For the SrsRemoteSensor.TYPE_WEARING_STATE sensor, the event comes once and the event delay is approximately 1 second. Note 2: SrsRemoteSensor.TYPE_USER_ACTIVITY and SrsRemoteSensor.TYPE_PEDOMETER sensors cannot use this method. For these sensors, this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        listener - A SrsRemoteSensorManager.EventListener object that will receive the sensor events.
        sensor - The SrsRemoteSensor object to register to.
        Returns:
        true if the sensor was successfully enabled, false otherwise.
